topic.title: How to create a Recurring Invoice
topic.shortdesc: Recurring invoices are where users can bill invoices to buyers at every billing cycle. Wave Financial makes charging your customer's saved credit card information so you can be paid instantly. Your invoices can now be customized to your preference.

ol.li: Under the sales tab, select estimate. This displays all the estimates you currently have. The option to create an estimate is also available.
Begin by selecting Create a Recurring Invoice.

Once on the next screen, fillout the invoice title and the summary of what the invoice is. The name of the invoice should be something recognizable.You want to be as descriptive as possible for the summary.
Select which customer to send the bill to.
Select a payment due date. the customer will pay off the invoice on this date. Payment due dates can be within 7 days to 90 days.
Add the cost by selecting the product.
Type in a description for the product in the description box. Be as detailed as possible.
Add the products price and tax.
Choose which type of currency the estimate uses. Wave Financial has multiple choices of currency to choose from spanning from economies across the world.
If needed, fill out the foot and notes section.
Select save to add the invoice.
The schdule must be set on the next screen. Select a date and time zone for the customer to receive their invoice. After the information is filled, Click Next.
Once finished, select Save upon arriving at the next screen. Automatic payments will now be made to the customer.

On the next screen, you will have the option to send invoices through email. enter the email of the invoices recipient. If needed, type an optional custom message for the recipient to inform them they are recieving an invoice. In addition, you can also choose to check "Attach PDF of the invoice to the email sent to the customer" or "Email a copy of each invoice to myself". Afterwards, click Next.
Select Approve and start recurring payments. Recurring payments will now begin.
